lines.text: Listen to me, Hillary. I'm not the first guy who fell in love with a woman that he met at a restaurant who turned out to be the daughter of a kidnapped scientist, only to lose her to her childhood lover who she last saw on a deserted island, who then turned out fifteen years later to be the leader of the French underground.
I know. It all sounds like some bad movie.
[Long pause. Both look at camera]
I know a little German. He's sitting over there.
the embassy, the German government, the consulate. I even talked to the U.N. ambassador. It's no use, I just can't bring my wife to orgasm.
My uncle was born in America.
Oh, really?
But he was one of the lucky ones. He managed to escape in a balloon during the Jimmy Carter presidency.
Who do you favor in the Virginia Slims tournament?
In women's tennis, I always root against the heterosexual.
Die Sauerkraut ist in mein Lederhosen.
If they find out you've seen this, your life will be worth less than a truckload of dead rats in a tampon factory.

[reporting on Nick's interrogation]
They're still working on him. He won't break. We've tried everything! Do you want me to bring out the Leroy Nieman paintings?
No. We cannot risk violating the Geneva Convention!
For as long as a single man is forced to cower under the iron fist of oppression, as long as a child cries out in the night, or an actor can be elected president, we must continue the struggle.
Martin, I've been practicing. How this?
Ist Ihr Tochter achtzehn, bitte?
What does that mean?
Is your daughter eighteen?

You see, a year ago, I was close to perfecting the first magnetic desalinization process so revolutionary, it was capable of removing the salt from over 500 million gallons of seawater a day. Do you realize what that could mean to the starving nations of the earth?
Wow. They'd have enough salt to last forever.
Things change, people change, hairstyles change, interest rates fluctuate.
[the East German national anthem]

Hail, hail East Germany / Land of fruit and grape / Land where you'll regret / If you try to escape / No matter if you tunnel under or take a running jump at the wall / Forget it, the guards will kill you, if the electrified fence doesn't first.
Hillary. That's an unusual name.
It's a German name. It means 'she whose bosoms defy gravity'.
I'm pleased to meet you. My name's Nick.
Nick? What does that mean?
Oh, nothing. My dad thought of it while he was shaving.
[on train at checkpoint]
Where are they taking him?
They are not taking him anywhere.
[gunshot is heard off screen]
[Nick and Hillary arrive at the Potato Farm. Shetland pony is coughing]
What's wrong with him?
Oh, he caught a cold last week and he's just a little hoarse.

[talking on the phone]
What is the condition of Sergeant Kruger?
[pause]
Very well, let me know if there is any change in his condition.
[Hangs up]
He's dead.

[sidling up to Blindman]
Know any good white basketball players?
There are no good white basketball players.
I'm afraid you leave me no alternative but to introduce you to two of my associates.
[a bald henchman comes forward]
Bruno is almost blind, has to operate wholly by touch.
[Cut to a blank-faced second man]
Klaus is a moron who knows only what he reads in the New York Post.
[Klaus is shown holding a copy of New York Post with the headline 'Maniac stalks Olivia Newton-John']
[Doctor Flamond is being rescued]
How ironic. Another day and I would have completed my tunnel.
Wait. You dropped your phony dog poo.
What phony dog poo?
Souvenirs, novelties, party tricks. Souvenirs, novelties, party tricks.
[a wounded Latrine stumbles into the Resistance hideout]
What did you find out, Latrine?
Where are the others?
Oh, we never had a chance. It was a slaughter.
We must put a stop to these afternoon football games.
Nigel, what are you saying?
How do we know he's NOT Mel Torme?
Is this the potato farm?
Yes, I'm Albert Potato.
Do you mind if I have a swig of this?
[picks up bottle]
Go right ahead.

[takes a mouthful, spits in disgust]
What the hell is this stuff?
Gasoline.
[laughs and takes a swig himself]
[throws dead carrier pigeon on table]
We have a traitor in our midst.
Well done, Latrine. I see that you have taken care of him appropriately.

[looks at Deja Vu]
Not the bird, you fool! This is a carrier pigeon on its way to the German Headquarters.
Nigel made me go back to the meter shed. He ordered me to set off the alarms.
And what does he want us to do now?
Nothing you numbskull, Nigel's the traitor!
Well, Mr. Rivers, it seems that you have become- How do you say indispensable?
Indispensable.
That's what I thought.
Something's wrong here. Where's the truck?
Where's Hillary?
I'm hungry.
Come on. We've got to get out of here.
Don't you think we ought to wait for the police?
That was the police!
Only a year ago, I was teaching a course in black history at the University of Blaupunkt.
[Introducing his men]
This is Chevalier, Montage, Detente, Avant Garde, and Deja Vu.
Haven't we met before monsieur ?
I don't think so.
Over there, Croissant, Souffle, Escargot, and Chocolate Mousse.
...And once again, Germany will be united under one rule - OURS. After Sunday, there will be no one to stop us.

[shouts]
Latrine!
Don't take it so hard Nick, life is filled with it's little miseries, each of us in his own way must learn to deal with adversity in a mature and adult fashion.
[Sneezes into hands screams, and jumps out a window]

[watching Nick perform in Der Pizza Haus]
This is *not* Mel Torme!
'Find Him And Kill Him'
Nick, whether you make it back or not, that plane must take off with Dr. Flammond at 1800 hours.
That's why we recommend you be there at least 45 minutes before departure, especially at this time of year.

[in German]
What do you recommend?

[in German]
I recommend the pork bellies marinated in diced pig entrails or the roast swine knuckles poached with flaming hog balls.
Anything's fine.
Are you in some kind of trouble with the police?
Some things are much better left unsaid.
Like what?

Well, you know... sometimes when you blow your nose into a tissue and you put it in your purse, then a little while later you have to reach in there for your lipstick or something, and your hand gushes into it, and it goes all over...
Okay, okay, you're right, you're right. Some things are better left unsaid.
Seems as long as I know my way around that prison, I'll never be lonely.
It was a Russian ship. They taught me all about you imperialist swine. I was exposed to the works of great thinkers - Karl Marx, Lenin, L. Ron Hubbard, Freddie Laker.
Go with Nick. Don't worry about us. We will hear his music on the Voice of America. We will hear it in the hearts of the people, and in elevators everywhere.
I want a schnauzer with my weinerschnitzel.
Excuse me but aren't you Nick Rivers, the American rock 'n' roll star?
No. No I'm not.
Oh, but you must be. If you could sing just one song...
I'm sorry but you must have me confused with someone else. I'm, uh... Mel Torme.

[hugging her friends before getting on plane]
Good-bye Chocolate Mousse, I'll never forget you. Good-bye Du Quois, take care of yourself. Good-bye Deja Vu, I'll always remember you. And I'll miss you most of all, Scarecrow.

[Du Quois gives the cow head part of the disguise to Nigel]
No, you take the head. I'm taking the back.
But the plan was...
Forget the plan. I'm giving the orders here. Now, shut up and give me the back part.
Alright, be an asshole.
[last lines]
And I'll miss you most of all scarecrow.
Here, smell this flower. It never fails to amuse at parties.
Good work, Chocolate Mousse.
